definition: chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
thick grass/"bush" component in Chinese characters
to cut (a canal, tunnel, well etc)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to bore a hole/to give a forced interpretation
lit. to pierce the wall to steal a light (idiom)/fig. to study diligently in the face of hardship
to put a square peg in a round hole/incompatible (idiom)
see 方枘圓鑿|方枘圆凿[fang1 rui4 yuan2 zao2]
a forced analogy (idiom); to jump to an unwarranted conclusion

sentences.english: Chung mud thickening meters more chisel, a ship to ship back to town.
sentences.chinese: 舂得泥稠米更凿，祈船未到镇船回。

sentences.english: We are like jewels, shaped with the hammer and chisel of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有如宝石，需要经过苦难的锤凿来雕琢。

sentences.english: Rugged aluminum encasing for the process unit.
sentences.chinese: 凹凸不平的凿铝为这一进程。

sentences.english: Mutilate, Backstab, Garrote and Ambush can no longer be dodged.
sentences.chinese: 毁伤，背刺，凿，伏击不再能被躲闪。

sentences.english: And when I got rid of this excess stone, there was David.
sentences.chinese: 凿去多余的石头之后，大卫就诞生了。

sentences.english: It's about fulfilling our potential, chipping away those limitations.
sentences.chinese: 关于实现我们的潜能，凿掉那些束缚。

sentences.english: He chipped a few pieces of ice from the large block.
sentences.chinese: 他从大冰块上凿下来几小块。

sentences.english: Solomon had seventy thousand carriers and eighty thousand stonecutters in the hills
sentences.chinese: 所罗门用七万扛抬的，八万在山上凿石头的。

sentences.english: He chiselled a hole in the door .
He is picking the surface of a millstone.
They holed a tunnel through the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他们凿了一条穿山隧道。

sentences.english: A maniac had gouged several holes in the priceless painting.
sentences.chinese: 有个狂徒在那幅价值连城的画上乱凿了几个洞。

sentences.english: The prisoners had tunnelled a big hole in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯们已经在墙上凿了一个大洞。

sentences.english: However, on the seventh day, Hun Dun bled from the seven orifices to death.
sentences.chinese: 可是，凿到第七天，浑沌却被凿得七孔流血而死了。

sentences.english: However, on the seventh day, Hun Dun bled from the seven orifices to death.
sentences.chinese: 可是，凿到第七天，浑沌却被凿得七孔流血而死了。

sentences.english: It's about chipping away the excess stone.

definition: to build by laying bricks or stones
a saw/to cut with a saw
to bore a hole/to give a forced interpretation
to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
to dig into/to cut a mine into
